text: On tap at Noctem. Almost clear copper with a small persistent ring of off-white lacing. Aroma is of biscuity malts with mineral notes, light fruitiness, mild spicy/peppery notes, herbal notes and caramel. Taste is sweet-ish with cereals, biscuity notes, mild fruitiness, caramel, peppery notes and mild earthy bitterness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Fruity and earthy finish that lingers a bit. An average Irish Ale that definitely doesnt belong in the top-50 of the style because of the rather low drinkability (too earthy) for the style. Not bad though.

En fût au Pub Chelsea (Chelsea, QC). Belle robe cuivrée. Leffervescence est modérée et le tout est coiffé dun mince col blanc cassé. Arôme malté et agrémenté de notes boisées et de sucre brun. En bouche, cest bien équilibré. On décèle encore des nuances de bois et de caramel. Bonne finale sucrée/boisée. Pas mal.
Overall: Malt, raisins, red berries.Note: On-tap at Gainsbourg. Reviewed 2015-04-27.

Pours a deep amber colour with a beige head, decent retention and a little lace. Malty nose with good grain, hints of farm aromas (fresh, in a good way) and light hops. The taste present mild sweetness, but nicely blended with the grassy hops and biscuit notes. The mouthfeel has a nice dry finish. A very nicely balanced Irish red brew with the caramel malts, roasted notes and hops.

En fût à la brasserie.
De couleur roux ou ambré foncé, la mousse est épaisse. 
Lattaque est à forte teneur de grain, décorce de céréales. de style fermier, accents de seigle, de sarazin. Elle est légèrement sucrée avec du caramel. Leffervescence est active. La texture, légèrement onctueuse. Le houblonnage présente une petite amertume mais laction se situe beaucoup plus dans les sucres et les grains. Bel équilibre.

On tap on the premises. Clear copper with a thin frothy off-white head. Flavors are bread, toasted malts, caramel, licorice and grass with earthy and nutty notes. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, slick texture.

On tap at brewery. Light clear mahogany with a light beige head. Light biscuit and roasted malt, bit of cherry. On the palate their is a surprisingly robust body with a high carbonation, some sweetness and then a mild bitter finish as things dry out.
Sample at the brew pub. Light copper, white head. Toffee and caramel with melanoidin and roasted notes. Grainy and a touch grassy, nice toffee, a touch roasted, quite malty, low bitterness, nice.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2016 En fût au Gainsbourg. Update janvier 2015***nouvelle recette***Couleur rubis, claire, mousse beige mince, superbes reflet.  Arôme de caramel écossais, grains frais, un peu de toffee. En bouche, une bonne rousse, maltée, caramel cuit, un peu dhoublon. Finale très sèche, malt, houblon léger. Très bonne rousse. UPDATE. Plus mince, plus commerciale.

tap on the premises. clear amber-reddish with a small light beige head showing some retention and lacing. toasted fruity and nuttu maltiness, crystal and munich malts, tobacco and pepper, herbal-grassiness. moderate carbonation, light body, short and balanced herbal-grassy-peppery finish. not so much of an irish red, but this stuff is a tasty red for sure.

A reddish copper ale with a thin off white head. In aroma, classic smooth biscuit malt with grassy English hops, like boréale rousse. In mouth, a nice crisp biscuit malt with good grassy British hops, very nice. On tap at brewery.
